author: {'steamid': '76561198077226160', 'num_games_owned': 550, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1708250199}
review:
Here is how to fix black screen problem if someone have the same problem with me: Set your system time format to English(US)

And if there is other problem, delete Neuston folder in C:\Users\Your User Name\AppData\LocalLow

I joined official discord to find this solutions and it works for me. 

Game itself is great and fun. Triple the fun if play with friends.

review: Game's fun but there isn't much content at all, after 20-30 minutes you get bored and have nothing more to do. I would recommend this game if you just wanted to play it once or twice before forgetting about it. I wish they would add anything that adds to the replayability of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075438139', 'num_games_owned': 1133, 'num_reviews': 191, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1703175057}
review:
I hope this game will get full body tracking at some point.  My biggest problem is my lack of real life space to be able to get really fanatic!  But also with limited moving space, it is still a great game! You will automatically rotate , so no need to move a lot.   But it is really hard not to move!  Because this volleyball game is very engaging and active!  And the playing just feels so nice!  I smashed my controllers together a few times in my attempts to hit the ball. 

I do not know how it plays on multiplayer level, since I only have been playing solo.  My gaming life so far has been quite passive in movement apart from a lot of mouse clicking:)  So this activity level takes some getting used to. I love it and as I said before, I really hope there are plans for full body tracking!  But also without this it is fun and it makes me sweat! excellent!

author: {'steamid': '76561199183768239', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1660754055}
review: This game is so much fun, I have like 200 VR games and I already think this is one of the best. I was thinking about trying it for 5 minutes because I didn't think it was going to be for me, but I spent 30 minutes having the best time. The direction the ball goes when you hit it is so accurate to what you meant to do, it really works well. Clicking things, menu, jump, seems to work sometimes, and sometimes not. You point and click click click click nothing happens then suddenly it selects (Quest 2) - Otherwise, absolutely superb, this should be on AppLab or the Quest Store itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198844051712', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1631236328}
review: Very fun game and easy to play! Really fun but sometimes it takes long to get into a game. It's definitely worth trying since it is very chill game and not many games are like this style. I wish there would be an option to talk to other players though, But overall this is one of my favorite games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994848572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1706155538}
review:
I knew I was in to it when I jumped into my ceiling when I was trying to beat my opponent for a tip at the net.

I suggest using one hand in this game and turning aim assist off.

If I were to add anything to this game I would say some sort of "season" or "tournament" game mode for solo.

My ceiling is ok thank you for asking.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978552772', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1615049002}
review:
First of all, it might be fun if you are not to much into volleyball and the concept is also nice and there ara nice animation when the ball hits the net.

I know it is still early access but there are too many things I dont like about the game:
[list]
[*]You [b]cannot use both hands/arms[/b] for playing like you would in real volleyball for setting (the ball will fly anywhere except for where you want it to)
[*]If you just let the ball hit your hand it bounces back really far, if you hit it hard, it is not much faster.
[*]You cannot go close to the net, you will stay about 1m away from it but the bots of your team often set the ball so that you would have to hit the ball directly over the net.
[*]Joistick movement is really slow
[*]No description on how to jump (it is pulling both triggers)
[*]No description what the settings do
[*]Jumping is just teleporting you into the air for 2s
[*]While jumping you can still move 
[*]Almost no Valleyball rules
[/list]
developer_response:
Thank you for the feedback! I reassure you that what you're saying is being read and carefully considered.

We have a community of players that are very active on Discord (many of them play volleyball IRL). Their feedback guides the development of the game. If you would be interested to join us and bounce ideas you're more than welcome: üôÇ https://discord.gg/CMVGFtbU

Two hands/arms: There's a specific feature that detects when the player brings the hands and arms together and modifies the physics model to better represent the intent of the player. It's not perfect, and we have seen that for some body types and VR setups this isn't detected properly. Going forward we'll adjust this to make sure it works better for people.

Ball goes far/short: By default, aim assist is enabled to make it possible for players of every skill level to play. The ball will be clamped to the play area so they you can't shoot it outside. If you are experiencing this with aim assist disabled, then it would be interesting to discuss it more.

Cannot go close to the net: Before players could go to the other side of the net. We talked with the players what we should accept. We decided that we should not be able to cross over, and we then keep the play area on "your side of the net" so you should be able to step forward to the net physically on your play area. If you can't, we can tweak they to let you move further.

Slow joystick movement: We have discussed this in Discord and decided that the movement should be faster. 

No settings descriptions: We have added more and more settings so players can tweak the experience to their liking. I agree with you that descriptions would be good!

Jumping is just teleporting: Some players have suggested that the jump should be a smooth animation up and down. Would that work for you, or do you have something else in mind?

Movement while jumping: in the beginning you couldn't move when jumping but players felt too constrained by that so we made it possible to move while jumping. Would you like an option to turn that off?

Volleyball rules: The fundamental volleyball rules are in place but there are a few things that we could add, for sure.

Thank you for the feedback, once again. I'd love to hear more so feel free to join us on Discord, or write a post here, or send an email to support@neuston.io

Have a great day! üôÇ

author: {'steamid': '76561198303408952', 'num_games_owned': 728, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1614602006}

author: {'steamid': '76561198841009236', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1614054917}
review: I like to play volley ball and this game needs A LOT of improvement.  Hands are stiff (as table tennis rackets), physics of the gameplay is still pretty basic, you are positioned in some specific spots but IA always sends it higher (it needs to check your height instead of sending the ball to higher spots), etc.  You have to relearn your volleyball moves in order to play this game.  Online gaming never worked.

author: {'steamid': '76561198199785238', 'num_games_owned': 114, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 992, 'last_played': 1682302659}
review:
Despite its many flaws and I mean MANY FLAWS... this is fundementally a good game especially considering the state its in. I enjoy it thouroughly as a fun casual game but its far from a substitute from real volleyball
Theres only 4 players on a team
No roles (Setter, libero, middle blocker etc) which leads to situations where im expecting to get set to and then the ball suddenly gets received to me for me to set. If you have aim assist off setting can be a real pain. 
No rules so rather frequently a receiver will set straight into a front row player from the back row
As many flaws and bugs as it has... I still do very much enjoy it and reccomend it to anyone looking to play some volleyball during the quarantine we're currently in.

review: This game is really good overall I used this game for a lab project where i measure my heart rate while playing VR. This is a cheap game where you can just play casually with or without friends. To be completely honest I lost track of time while playing since i had so much fun, AND PLEASE BE CAREFUL! I SPIKED MY CEILING FAN because i got way to into the game, the ceiling fan is fine. Overall great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561199018063908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1667811767}
review:
I just want to say that this is probably the best volleyball game out there to exist! It is fun, great physics, and plays like real volleyball. You recieve, set, and spike. I haven't found any other volleyball game that compares to this. I know this game is still in early access and you guys are still working on it, but there are still some things that I would love if you guys added an option or changed. For instance
- Setting 
I feel that the setting in this game is really awkward and unrealistic. You just use one hand and slap it. I tried to set the ball with my two hands above my head like in real life, but it just doesn't work. If you guys could some how find a way to integrate more realistic setting with both hands, it would be amazing. 
- AI Setting
The setting overall is pretty good with the AI, but starts to feel repetitive. However, now that you added the ability to move with the joy stick, it unlocks more potential to spike from different areas, but the problem is that the AI isn't the best at reading where you are. I wish there were an option for the bot to always set to you so you can practice spiking anywhere in single player. (Since we have quarentine, I would love to practice different spiking position.)
- Receiving 
The receiving is also very smooth and nice, however It doesn't have the real volleyball feel. The best way to receive in this game is by one again, slapping the ball with one hand. Realistic volleyball, you have to receive with both hands and use your forearms. If you could find a way to make it more realistic, it would be even more amazing. 

I know that this is alot of things to change and might make the game completely different, so maybe you could make it a whole new game mode, like "realistic volleyball." Idk, but overall this game is really good and I will continue to play it!

review:
dev responded helpful.


original:
Ai is laughable.

No online players.
developer_response:
There's a new update since you wrote this review: you can now set the bot skill to a higher level (no more shooting the ball into the sand like idiots, and they can jump block as well).

It's hard to find online players, I know. Two players have to want to start a multiplayer game at the exact same time, and that's tricky even for big titles. But the player base is steadily growing and the best way to find other players is to join us on Discord at https://discord.gg/qJVgwX.

If you have any suggestions you're more than welcome to drop me an email at support@neuston.io or join us on Discord!

author: {'steamid': '76561198851998673', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1606233191}
review:
Alright bro, so let me start off with, this is an EXCELLENT GAME. Very well designed, very well made, and cheap for what it offers. The only reason that i've only played this game for 3 and a half hours, is because it lacks customization. This game can be one of the best VR games out there and I know it! Before stops being early access, and you guys release it to full access, I recommend you doing some of the changes and adding some of the features I have listed here:

-Body and uniform customization. Make a menu where you can change your skin color, shirt color, pants color, skin color, etc.

-Difficulty customization. Make an easy, medium and hard. The easier you get the less harder they hit, and the harder difficulty you get they hit harder and do more accurate hits and dumps etc.

-Bump assist toggle. Right now, in normal mode, you can legit turn around and serve the ball behind you, and your back left person will just bump it over as if nothing happen. Sometimes I try to lose, and its actually really hard.

-More maps. You guys are probably already working on this, but I think that an indoor court or smthn would be really cool.

- Ajust how many people are on a court at once. 12 people, 8 people, 4 people, and 2.

Overall, great game, and I recommend it to anyone who wants a really good volleyball simulator. Work on these suggestions to make it the best it can be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020445786', 'num_games_owned': 1090, 'num_reviews': 231, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1562255970}
review:
[h1]30minVR[/h1] [url=steamcommunity.com/groups/30minvr][b]STEAM Group[/b][/url] / [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33700466-30-minutes-exercising-in-VR/][b] STEAM Curator[/b][/url]
[b]GAMEPLAY VIDEO:[/b] https://youtu.be/OIvb4nrdpbQ

VR EXERCISE RATING: EASY
GAMEPLAY RATING: FAIR

A really nice pace and flow, quite a relaxing experience. The ball direction is partly managed by the game which makes it's easy to pick up and play, but it still follows your aiming so does feel like you are in control. It's a method that works well in this casual Volleyball game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056034720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1623718256}
review:
In VR, there really isn't much you can just 'Quickly do'. This scratches that itch right on the head. Allow me to elaborate:

Lets say you log into steam after work to see that your favorite game just got a six gigabyte update. Typically, one would load up a 'low end game' and let the update run in the background; something mindless to pass the time. 

In VR, that really isn't an option. Any VR game you launch typically can take a few minutes to load (if your like me; a slave to spinny drives) and leave you standing in the room spinning aimlessly in circles. By the time the game is loaded, you've already made yourself motion sick and do not require the game to do it for you. I would hope we both agree that this few minutes of wasted time cannot be allowed to continue! How dare I allow myself to stand there bored!

That's where Volleyball Fever comes in. 
Vollyball Fever has absolutely no complications to it. The game turns on nearly instantly, runs smoothly, and allows you to play something mindless yet entertaining while other games download or simply just to pass time. Of course there are cracks... odd AI behavior, occasional crashes, ect.. but if you allow this game to just be a hub between two other games, or even just a way to pass a quick 10 minutes, this game scratches an itch that I have not yet seen scratched before in VR; Especially if you can just grab the game for 5$ on sale. 

Keep Scratching, Vollyball Fever!
